questions.question_title: What is an easy and effective way to conserve water?

answers.answer_text: Take shorter showers.
Leave the tap running while brushing your teeth.
Using garden sprinklers during a storm.

questions.question_title: Which of these helps keep drinking water safe?

answers.answer_text: Storing water in a sealed, clean container.
Leaving water outside uncovered.
Mixing old and new water together.

questions.question_title: Why is handwashing important for hygiene?

answers.answer_text: It removes germs that can make us sick.
It wastes water without benefit.
It makes water dirty.

questions.question_title: What is one way schools can help ensure clean water for students?

answers.answer_text: Install water filters on taps.
Remove all drinking fountains.
Ask students to bring no water.

questions.question_title: Which practice helps protect local rivers and lakes?

answers.answer_text: Properly disposing of trash and chemicals.
Throwing waste into storm drains.
Washing cars in the middle of a stream.

questions.question_title: What can communities do to improve sanitation?

answers.answer_text: Build and maintain proper toilets and latrines.
Use fields as open toilets.
Ignore broken sanitation facilities.

questions.question_title: How does planting trees help water availability?

answers.answer_text: Roots help the soil hold and filter water.
Leaves block all rain from reaching the ground.
Trees drink too much water and dry up rivers.

questions.question_title: Which technology can help monitor water quality?

answers.answer_text: Sensors that detect pollutants in real time.
Blindly tasting water samples.
Ignoring lab tests completely.

questions.question_title: Why should everyone learn about WASH (Water, Sanitation, Hygiene)?

answers.answer_text: So they know how to stay healthy and protect water.
So they can waste water faster.
So they forget to wash their hands.

questions.question_title: What role can kids play in saving water at home?

answers.answer_text: Turning off taps tightly after use.
Leaving taps dripping overnight.
Brushing teeth with tap running.

questions.question_title: Which habit helps reduce waterborne diseases?

answers.answer_text: Boiling or treating water before drinking.
Drinking water from puddles.
Using the same water for cooking and washing without cleaning.

questions.question_title: How can governments support universal WASH by 2030?

answers.answer_text: Funding infrastructure and education programmes.
Cutting budgets for water projects.
Stopping hygiene classes in schools.
